section.title: The Action menu
section.para: From the Actions menu you can access your Preferences and configure Servers. If your enthusiasm for GêBR has lead you to read the whole manual, you have probably used almost all available features found in these options. But just in case, below you will find the documentation for these options.

section.title: Preferences
section.para: The details you provide in the Preferences dialog box will be adopted as the default by GêBR. Specifically:

listitem.para: User name: will be used as the default for Author: when you create Projects, Lines and Flows.
Email: will be used as the default for Email: when you create Projects, Lines and Flows.
User's menus directory: will be the default directory where GêBR's Menus are maintained (mnu files).

mediaobject.caption: Preferences menu opens a dialog box where you edit the user name, email, menu's directory and the HTML editor.

section.title: Maestro/Servers configuration
section.para: The Maestro/Servers Interface has three parts:

listitem.para: Servers: choose the servers associated to the current Maestro.
Groups: configure the groups of Servers on the current Maestro.

section.title: Maestro
section.para: In the upper part of the Servers Interface (see ), there is an entry in which the user can put the desired machine to use as Maestro. A requirement is that the package GêBR-Maestro must be installed on that machine. The state of the connection between GêBR and the Maestro is shown by the right-side icon:

section.title: Servers
section.para: Once the Maestro has been selected and the connection has been successfully established, the user can associate working machines to that Maestro.
The lines represent the machines associated to the Maestro. Each line has some columns:

listitem.para: AC: checkbox to activate or not the auto-connection to that server.
MPI: depicst whether the machine has support to MPI.
Address: hostname or IP address of the working machine.
CPU Clock: CPU clock of the working machine.

section.para: The user can add a new machine by clicking over New and entering the hostname or IP address of the machine.

section.title: Groups
section.para: The user can employ a subset of the machines associated to the Maestro. This can be done through the creation of groups of machines.
In the bottom part of the Servers interface (see ), the user can create/edit Servers groups. The user must Drag and Drop the Server to create a group.
To create a group, the user needs to click over a server in the list and drag it to the + icon. A text box will be prompted for the name of the group. Groups with same names are not accepted.
